CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 2, 1961, pg. 3, reads: "Site of Explosion - A faulty converted gas furnace in basement of this house located at 244 Ophelia St., exploded recently, injuring one of the tenants. Occupants said they had requested repairs many times. - Harris Photos."  Portion of accompanying article reads: "DePaul Smith...A Liability or Asset?  Editor's note: While Pittsburgh (The Renaissance City) proudly displays its renovation of the Golden Triangle, highlights by the $22 million Civic Arena, to its many citizens and visitors, and maps magnificent plans for 'urban renewal, it has 'swept under the rug its 'dregs of human misery' - those displaced persons, a majority of whom are Negroes, who either have not been relocated or are unable to find suitable housing on their own.  Crack Courier reporter Phyl Garland has gone behind the scenes to interview and write about these 'Prisoners of the Ghetto' and their vicious 'jailer.'  This is the second in a series of articles which The Courier offers its readers..."
TitMainTitle: Three story narrow brick house, with five mailboxes, mansard roof, porch, and third floor balcony, 244 Ophelia Street, Oakland
